https://prez.dev/description.@value: The subject is an instance of a class.
The defininition of the subject resource.
An idea or notion; a unit of thought
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included
Relates a concept to a concept that is more specific in meaning
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language
Relates a concept to the concept scheme that it is a top level concept of

This vocabulary lists the fundamental types of geological features that are used to define the geological framework/4D evolution of Western Australia and are relevant to the duties of the Geological Survey of Western Australia. A geological feature is a physical or conceptual feature that is hypothesized to exist coherently in the Earth and that results from geological processes (definition largely derived from SWEET ontology http://sweetontology.net/realmGeol#geologicfeature).

Stratigraphic and lithodemic units that are formally defined and named in the Australian Stratigraphic Units Database (https://www.ga.gov.au/data-pubs/datastandards/reference-databases/stratigraphic-units) following conventions set out in the International Stratigraphic Guide (Salvador, 1994; an abridged version of the guide is available at https://stratigraphy.org/guide/index.html).
An assemblage of rocks that is unified on the basis  of structural or deformational features, mutual relations, origin or historical evolution. It may be igneous, sedimentary, metamorphic or mixed.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A named body of rock (sedimentary, igneous, metamorphic or mixed), that is defined and characterized on the basis of its observable and distinctive lithological properties or combination of lithological properties and stratigraphic/field relations. It represents the basic unit of geological mapping and includes formally defined stratigraphic and lithodemic units (cf Australian Stratigraphic Units Database, www.ga.gov.au/data-pubs/datastandards/stratigraphic-units) as well as lithotectonic units defined solely on the basis of lithologic properties and inclusion within a tectonic unit.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: One of the foundation elements in GSWA's Explanatory Notes System, used to define the geological framework of an area. Definition adapted from American Geosciences Institute Glossary of Geology (5th edition).

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A named body of rock (sedimentary, igneous, metamorphic or mixed), that is defined and characterized on the basis of its observable and distinctive lithological properties or combination of lithological properties and stratigraphic/field relations. It represents the basic unit of geological mapping and includes formally defined stratigraphic and lithodemic units (cf Australian Stratigraphic Units Database, www.ga.gov.au/data-pubs/datastandards/stratigraphic-units) as well as lithotectonic units defined solely on the basis of lithologic properties and inclusion within a tectonic unit.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc
